comments.body: is it ok to have two "env" sections?
It's fine but what I just learned, it won't override the default `SHARD`. So I had to explicitly specify it in 17997ef.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@  windows_container:
    dockerfile: dev/bots/docker/Dockerfile.windows
  env:
    CIRRUS_WORKING_DIR: "C:\\Windows\\Temp\\flutter sdk"
  git_fetch_script: git fetch origin

comments.body: Do we need to explicitly set `OS_NAME` to "linux" here and in the docs shard?  i.e. do our scripts assume that `OS_NAME` is always set?

Yes, it should be set.  Not all of the scripts assume that (the docs script doesn't), but they should be able to.

In this case, it is set to `linux`, from the `env:` section at the task level, so we don't need to set it in the matrix here.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +20,24 @@    - name: deploy_gallery
      env:
        SHARD: deploy_gallery
        GOOGLE_DEVELOPER_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_ACTOR_FASTLANE: ENCRYPTED[d9ac1462c3c556fc2f8165c9d5566a16497d8ebc38a50357f7f3abf136b7f83e1d1d76dde36fee356cb0f9ebf7a89346]
        ANDROID_GALLERY_UPLOAD_KEY: ENCRYPTED[0b3e681b4507aec433ef29c79b715f15f8c75ecd25315ea286b0b2bcb8b28d578634eead5aa2c54086a25e8da1bb219a]
